title: The biggest obstacle to Ukraine’s counteroffensive? Minefields.
description: Areas between 3 and 10 miles deep in front of the Russians’ main strongholds have been densely mined with antitank and antipersonnel mines and trip wires.

title: European heat wave sparks multiple warnings, shuts Greece’s Acropolis
description: Parts of Europe could face temperatures up to 111.2 degrees due to a heat wave nicknamed Cerberus, after a dog guarding the gates of hell in Greek mythology.

title: Inside America’s failed, forgotten conference to save Jews from Hitler
description: President Franklin D. Roosevelt called the Evian conference in France in 1938, as the Holocaust loomed. It remains, today, “an indelible stain on American and world history.”

title: Climate activists disrupted Wimbledon, exposed split in movement
description: U.K.’s climate movement is divided over whether Just Stop Oil's disruptive protests are an important passion project or surefire way to alienate supporters.

title: The plane that crashed in the Amazon also crashed in 2021
description: The Cessna barreled through the tree canopy and plowed into the ground two years ago.

title: Flooding in South Korea leaves at least seven dead and three missing
description: Torrential rains destroyed homes and triggered landslides. Hundreds of residents were asked to evacuate.

title: Ukraine live briefing: Deadline for crucial grain deal looms; Putin says he offered Wagner fighters spots in Russian military
description: The Black Sea Grain Initiative, which has helped ease the global food crisis, is set to expire Monday. But President Vladimir Putin hasn't responded to the U.N.

title: India’s favorite girl never grows up. But her wit is less welcome.
description: The Amul Butter girl is still a sharp societal critic, but can her wit survive in a new India?

title: The ‘Shoe Bomber’ testified for him. He was acquitted of terror charges.
description: Nizar Trabelsi, a former professional soccer player in Germany, was arrested just after the Sept. 11 attacks and accused of plotting to kill Americans in Europe.
